metadata.title: CVE-2014-0515 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Buffer overflow in Adobe Flash Player before 11.7.700.279 and 11.8.xthrough 13.0.x before 13.0.0.206 on Windows and OS X, and before11.2.202.356 on Linux, allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary codevia unspecified vectors, as exploited in the wild in April 2014.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-0515` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

flashplugin-downloader - 11.2.202.356
flashplugin-installer - 11.2.202.356
No subscription required

criterions.comment: flashplugin-nonfree package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '11.2.202.356').
